metadata.title: CVE-2024-36600 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer Overflow Vulnerability in libcdio v2.1.0 allows an attacker toexecute arbitrary code via a crafted ISO 9660 image file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-36600` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcdio-utils - 2.0.0-2ubuntu0.2
libcdio18 - 2.0.0-2ubuntu0.2
libiso9660-11 - 2.0.0-2ubuntu0.2
libudf0 - 2.0.0-2ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libcdio package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0-2ubuntu0.2').
